page.title: 19Cheriton Fitz.- Recreation
page.content: There have been {allotments}at least since 1925. Since 1965 the Parish has bought a{playing field}and received a gift of land for a small children's { {playground}.David Yeandle,aged 11, writes:"There is a playing field called{Jack's Acre}named after my Grandad, Edward John Yeandle/but Jack was his nickname.He opened it in 1980" The school play football and hold Sports Day here. In the 1970s the parents provided a small open-air {swimming bath}grant-aided by the Education Authority. Of the two established public houses one has a skittle-alley. The{Parish Hall}, built on land given by the then Rector in the 1930s, is in constant use.
